prompt_markdown: What is a **system call**? Describe the mechanism by which a user-space program invokes kernel functionality.

criteria.name: definition
criteria.description: Defines syscall as the interface between user programs and kernel

criteria.name: mechanism
criteria.description: Describes the trap/interrupt mechanism that switches to kernel mode

expected_key_points: syscall is a request to the kernel
triggers a software interrupt or trap instruction
kernel validates and executes the request
examples: read, write, open, fork, exec
common_mistakes: confusing syscalls with library functions like printf
thinking syscalls are regular function calls
